results.title: Channel Seven Sport : Up There Cazaly [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
A television commercial for Channel Seven Sport’s coverage of Australian Rules Football, using the song ‘Up There Cazaly’ written by Mike Brady and Peter Sullivan. The song was inspired by the high flying marks of Roy Cazaly who played during the 1920s. The commercial shows some spectacular high marks and bruising bumps.
Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: World Series Cricket : C'mon Aussie c'mon [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
An advertisement for the first season of World Series Cricket featuring the now famous song ‘C’mon Aussie c’mon’ originally performed by the Mojo Singers.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Holeproof Computer Socks [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
A commercial for Holeproof ‘Computer Socks’ set in a patent office, where the inventor’s glee at his discovery (‘they fall up, not down’) causes Isaac Newton to rethink his theory of gravity.
Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Holeproof Antz Pantz [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
A commercial for Holeproof Antz Pantz featuring an echidna called Rex. The ad caused some heated debate when first aired. in the late 1980s.
Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Yellow Pages: Goggomobil [advertisement]
results.brief_description: Tommy Dysart stars as the man searching through the Yellow Pages business telephone directory for a mechanic who can help his beloved, a rare ‘Goggomobil’ car from the 1950s (‘not the Dart’).

results.title: Lamb Roast [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Naomi Watts stars in this commercial as the girl that wins a date with Tom Cruise but turns it down so she can be at home for one of her Mum’s lamb roasts.
Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Bellbird: Episode 205
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, Oscar Whitbread and ABC
results.brief_description:
The ABC produced 1693 episodes of ‘Bellbird’ and the series ran for 10 years, until 1977. The series was a huge hit in rural and regional Australia because it dealt with the concerns of people living on the land and the dynamics of small country town life.
Episode 205 was broadcast on 1 January 1967.
